p: The temperature at which D 14 reaches its maximum value is sensitive to the polar order of BaZr xTi 1−xO 3. For ferroelectric ceramics (BZ0, BZ5 and BZ15), the maximum of D 14 is at ca. 10 °C and does not change with composition. By contrast, it progressively shifts to lower temperatures in relaxor and paraelectric ceramics on increasing Zr 4+ content: −13 °C for BZ30, −55 °C for BZ50, −60 °C for BZ70, −65 °C for BZ100.
